intro.title: Ready to start your Developer Journey?
intro.text: Just like a chef needs a cooking environment and a carpenter needs a woodworking environment, so does a developer need a **development environment**. If you're **serious** about becoming a Software Developer - which is awesome - then you need to setup your development environment before getting down to business.

steps.title: Step 1. Get a Code Editor
steps.text: Think of a Code Editor as a glorified Microsoft Word for writing code. As a matter of fact, the best and coolest - and free - code editor out is **Visual Studio Code**, from Microsoft.

steps.title: Step 2. Get a Terminal
steps.text: The second most useful tool in your developer arsenal is your Terminal. This is where you will type in commands and interact with your development environment. Get **Hyper** - a free and awesome terminal.

steps.title: Step 3. Get Node.js
steps.text: You will be coding in **JavaScript** so that means you need a way to run JavaScript on your computer. This is where **Node.js** comes in, a JavaScript environment.

text.max:
You're now ready to install me on your machine. Yaay! Just type:

```npm i -g chunky-cli```

steps.title: Step 5. Say Hello
steps.text:
Congrats, you made it! Just type:

```chunky carmel say hello```
